basic.description: Returns the running lua api version as a string, e.i., 'Lua 5.3'.
Prints the given string.
Prints the given value, converting the given value to a string.
Returns the given argument as a number.
Returns the given argument as a string in a human-readable format.
Returns the type of its only argument, coded as a string.
Calls 'error' function if the 'value' is false (i.e., nil or false); otherwise, returns all its arguments.
This function is a generic interface to the garbage collector.
Terminates the last protected function called and returns 'message' as the error object.
Returns all arguments after argument number 'index'.
Allows a program to traverse all fields of a table.
Returns the 'table' metamethod field '__metatable' associated value, if the field doens't exist returns nil.
Sets the metatable for the given table.
Calls the 'table' metamethod field '__pairs' with 'table' as argument, alongside with the first three results from the call.
Returns three values (an iterator function, the 'table', and 0).
Opens the named file and executes its contents as a Lua chunk.
Loads a chunk.
Similar to 'load', but gets the chunk from 'fileName' or from the standard input, if no file name is given.
Calls 'function' with the given arguments in protected mode.
This 'function' is similar to pcall, except that it sets a new message handler.
Gets the real value of 'table[index]', without invoking the '__index' metamethod.
Sets the real value of 'table[index]' to value, without invoking the '__newindex' metamethod.
Checks whether 'value1' is equal to 'value2', without invoking the '__eq' metamethod. Returns a boolean.
Returns the length of the 'object', which must be a table or a string, without invoking the '__len' metamethod. Returns an integer.

coroutine.description: Creates a new coroutine, with body 'func'.
Creates a new coroutine, with body 'func'.
Returns the status of the given coroutine, as a string.
Returns the running coroutine and a boolean.
Starts or continues the execution of a given coroutine.
Returns true when the running coroutine can yield.
Suspends the execution of the calling coroutine.

package.description: The path used by require to search for a Lua loader.
The path used by 'require' to search for a C loader.
A table to store loaders for specific modules.
A table used by 'require' to control which modules are already loaded.
Dynamically links the host program with the C library 'libName'.
A table used by 'require' to control how to load modules.
Searches for the given name in the given 'path'.
A string describing some compile-time configurations for packages.

string.description: Returns the internal numeric codes of the characters 's[i]', 's[i+1]', ..., 's[j]'.
Returns a string with length equal to the number of arguments, in which each character has the internal numeric code equal to its corresponding argument.
Returns a string containing a binary representation (a binary chunk) of the given function.
Looks for the first match of pattern in the string 's'.
Returns a formatted version of its variable number of arguments following the description given in its first argument (which must be a string).
Receives a string 's' and returns its length.
Returns a string that is the concatenation of 'n' copies of the string 's' separated by the string 'sep'.
Returns a string that is the string 's' reversed.
Receives a string and returns a copy of this string 's' with all characters to uppercase.
Receives a string and returns a copy of this string 's' with all characters to lowercase.
Returns an iterator function that, each time it is called, returns the next captures from 'pattern' over the string 's'.
Replaces the part string 's' that matches 'pattern' with 'repl'.
Looks for the first match of 'pattern' in the string 's'.
Returns the substring of string 's' that starts at 'i' and continues until 'j'; 'i' and 'j' can be negative.
Returns the values packed in string 's' according to the format string 'fmt'.
Returns a binary string containing arguments packed according to the format string 'fmt'.
Returns the size of a string resulting from 'string.pack' with the given format.

utf8.description: Converts each one to its corresponding UTF-8 byte sequence and returns a string with the concatenation of all these sequences.
The pattern (a string, not a function) '[\0-\x7F\xC2-\xF4][\x80-\xBF]*', which matches exactly one UTF-8 byte sequence, assuming that the subject is a valid UTF-8 string.
Returns values for a iterator function (for in).
Returns the codepoints (as integers) from all characters in 's' that start between byte position 'i' and 'j' (both included).
Returns the number of UTF-8 characters in string 's' that start between positions 'i' and 'j' (both inclusive).
Returns the position (in bytes) where the encoding of the 'n'-th character of 's' (counting from position 'i') starts.

table.description: Given a list where all elements are strings or numbers, returns the string 'list[i]'..'sep'..'list[i+1]' ··· 'sep..list[j]'.
Inserts element value at position 'pos' in 'list', shifting up the elements 'list[pos]', 'list[pos+1]', ···, 'list[#list]'.
Removes from 'list' the element at position 'pos', returning the value of the removed element.
Moves elements from table 'a1' to table 'a2'.
Sorts list elements in a given order, in-place, from 'list[1]' to 'list[#list]'.
Returns the elements from the given list.
Returns a new table with all parameters stored into keys 1, 2, etc. and with a field "n" with the total number of parameters.

math.description: The value of π.
Returns the absolute value of 'x' (integer/float).
Returns the arc cosine of 'x' (in radians).
Returns the arc sine of 'x' (in radians).
Returns the arc tangent of 'y'/'x' (in radians), but uses the signs of both parameters to find the quadrant of the result.
Returns the smallest integral value larger than or equal to 'x'.
Returns the cosine of 'x' (assumed to be in radians).
Converts the angle 'x' from radians to degrees.
Returns the value 'e^x' (where e is the base of natural logarithms).
Returns the largest integral value smaller than or equal to 'x'.
Returns the remainder of the division of 'x' by 'y' that rounds the quotient towards zero (integer/float).
Returns the logarithm of 'x' in the given base. The default for base is 'e' (so that the function returns the natural logarithm of 'x').
The float value 'HUGE_VAL', a value larger than any other numeric value.
Returns the argument with the maximum value, according to the Lua operator < (integer/float).
An integer with the maximum value for an integer.
Returns the argument with the minimum value, according to the Lua operator < (integer/float).
An integer with the minimum value for an integer.
Returns the integral part of 'x' and the fractional part of 'x'. Its second result is always a float.
Converts the angle 'x' from degrees to radians.
When called without arguments, returns a pseudo-random float with uniform distribution in the range '[0,1)'.
Sets 'x' as the "seed" for the pseudo-random generator: equal seeds produce equal sequences of numbers.
Returns the sine of 'x' (assumed to be in radians).
Returns the square root of 'x' (You can also use the expression 'x^0.5' to compute this value.).
Returns the tangent of 'x' (assumed to be in radians).
If the value 'x' is convertible to an integer, returns that integer. Otherwise, returns nil.
Returns "integer" if 'x' is an integer, "float" if it is a float, or nil if 'x' is not a number.
Returns a boolean, true if and only if integer 'm' is below integer 'n' when they are compared as unsigned integers.

io.description: Equivalent to 'file:close()'. Without a file, closes the default output file.

When called with a file name, it opens the named file (in text mode), and sets its handle as the default input file. When called with a file handle, it simply sets this file handle as the default input file. When called without parameters, it returns the current default input file.
Opens the given file name in read mode and returns an iterator function that works like 'file:lines(···)' over the opened file.
This function opens a file, in the mode specified in the string 'mode'. In case of success, it returns a new file handle.
Similar to 'io.input', but operates over the default output file.
This function is system dependent and is not available on all platforms.
In case of success, returns a handle for a temporary file. This file is opened in update mode and it is automatically removed when the program ends.
Checks whether obj is a valid file handle. Returns the string "file" if 'object' is an open file handle, "closed file" if obj is a closed file handle, or nil if obj is not a file handle.
Returns an iterator function that, each time it is called, reads the file according to the given formats.
Reads the 'file', according to the given formats, which specify what to read.
Returns the final file position, measured in bytes from the beginning of the file.
Sets the buffering mode for an output file.
Writes the value of each of its arguments to 'file'. The arguments must be strings or numbers.

os.description: Returns an approximation of the amount in seconds of CPU time used by the program.
Returns a string or a table containing date and time, formatted according to the given string 'format'.
Returns the current time when called without arguments, or a time representing the local date and time specified by the given table.
Returns the difference, in seconds, from time 't1' to time 't2' (where the times are values returned by 'os.time').
This function is equivalent to the ISO C function 'system'. It passes 'command' to be executed by an operating system shell.
Calls the ISO C function exit to terminate the host program.
Deletes the file (or empty directory, on POSIX systems) with the given name.
Renames the file or directory named 'oldName' to 'newName'.
Returns the value of the process environment variable 'varName', or nil if the variable is not defined.
Sets the current locale of the program.
Returns a string with a file name that can be used for a temporary file.

debug.description: Enters an interactive mode with the user, running each string that the user enters.
Returns the current hook settings of the thread, as three values: the current hook function, the current hook mask, and the current hook count (as set by the 'debug.sethook' function).
Returns a table with information about a function.
This function returns the name and the value of the local variable with index 'local' of the function at level 'func' of the stack.
Returns the metatable of the given 'value' or nil if it does not have a metatable.
This function returns the name and the value of the upvalue with index 'up' of the function 'func'.
Returns the Lua value associated to 'u'. If 'u' is not a full userdata, returns nil.
Sets the given function as a 'hook'. The string 'mask' and the number 'count' describe when the hook will be called.
This function assigns the 'value' to the local variable with index 'local' of the function at 'level' of the stack.
Sets the metatable for the given value to the given 'table' (which can be nil). Returns 'value'.
This function assigns the 'value' to the upvalue with index 'up' of the function 'func'.
Sets the given value as the Lua 'value' associated to the given 'udata'. Returns 'udata'.
If 'message' is present but is neither a string nor nil, this function returns 'message' without further processing.
Returns a unique identifier (as a light userdata) for the upvalue numbered 'n' from the given function.
Make the 'n1'-th upvalue of the Lua closure 'f1' refer to the 'n2'-th upvalue of the Lua closure 'f2'.
